meanings.definition: Coempts: to share equally in a common fund or property
meanings.sent1: The siblings coempts the inheritance from their parents.
meanings.sent2: In the partnership, they coempts the profits from the business.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to coempts the cost of the pizza for a fun night.
meanings.sent4: The community coempts the responsibility of maintaining the park.
meanings.sent5: The team coempts the victory after a hard-fought match.

meanings.definition: Coempts: those who share equally in a common fund or property
meanings.sent1: The coempts of the estate gathered to discuss its management.
meanings.sent2: She is one of the coempts of the family heirlooms.
meanings.sent3: The coempts of the treasure chest argued over its contents.
meanings.sent4: The coempts of the company enjoyed the benefits of their shared ownership.
meanings.sent5: The coempts of the prize money celebrated their win together.
